partName: Honda H22A Swap (The 'H2B' or Accord Swap)
notes: The H22A (Prelude VTEC) drops directly into 90-97 Accords with factory mounts (using the F22 transmission side mount). It's the easiest way to give an old Accord 200hp. For Civics, 'H2B' kits allow you to mate the H22 engine to a B-series transmission for better gearing.

The 'J-Swap' secret: Put J32A2 heads (from TL Type-S) onto a J35A block (from Odyssey/MDX). You get the high-flowing heads and cams of the Type-S with the massive torque and displacement of the minivan engine. A cheap way to build a 300hp N/A V6.

The cheapest VTEC upgrade. Take the VTEC cylinder head (D16Z6 or D16Y8) from an EX/Si and bolt it onto your non-VTEC block (D15B7 or D16Y7). Requires the VTEC solenoid, a timing belt match (usually the Z6 belt), and wiring the VTEC pressure switch to the ECU.

You can convert a FWD Civic/Integra to AWD using the transmission, driveshaft, and rear differential from a 1st Gen CR-V (B20 engine). Requires welding the rear differential support into the Civic floorpan and using custom rear trailing arms or modifying the CR-V ones.

partName: Mitsubishi DSM 1G Head on 2G Block (6-Bolt vs 7-Bolt)
notes: The 1G (90-94) 4G63 head has massive intake ports compared to the 2G (95-99). Putting a 1G head on a 2G block is a classic high-flow upgrade. Requires matching the intake manifold and drilling out the head bolt holes (11mm vs 12mm) to fit the 2G block studs.

The 4-piston front calipers from a 3000GT VR4 (1st Gen) bolt directly onto 1G DSMs and Galant VR4s. Massive stopping power. 2nd Gen 3000GT brakes are even bigger but require custom brackets. Requires 16-inch or larger wheels.

The 5th Gen Mirage Coupe (US) is the same chassis as the JDM Evo 4/5/6. You can swap the entire Evo drivetrain (4G63T, AWD system, suspension) into the Mirage. The floorpan requires modification to fit the rear diff and driveshaft, but the suspension pickup points are largely there.

The 2nd Gen DSM 7-bolt 4G63T is infamous for 'crankwalk' (thrust bearing failure), which destroys the engine block. The 1G 6-bolt engine (1990-1992.5) is immune. Many 2G owners swap in a 6-bolt engine to avoid this.

partName: Mitsubishi Evo X / Ralliart SST Transmission Issues
notes: The Getrag TC-SST dual-clutch transmission is prone to clutch fork magnet failure and overheating. Regular fluid changes (DiaQueen SSTF-I) are critical. Installing an external transmission cooler is mandatory for track use.
The Galant VR-4 (US Spec) came with 4x114.3 hubs. You can swap to 5x114.3 hubs using parts from a 1G Eclipse GSX (AWD) or specific non-US Galant knuckles. Opens up a huge range of wheel options.

The 2.5L Twin Turbo V6 (6A13TT) from the Galant VR-4 fits into the FTO and Lancer engine bays. It's a tight squeeze, but provides 280hp stock. The FTO's FWD gearbox can be used, but traction will be an issue.

The ultimate NA Honda build. Use the 2.4L block (K24) from an Accord/CR-V for torque, and the head from a K20A2/Z3 (RSX-S/Civic Si) for high RPM flow. Requires a K24 head gasket and CR-V passenger side engine mount bracket.

All hydraulic B-series transmissions interchange. The B16 (Civic Si) and B18C (GSR/Type R) have short gears for acceleration. The LS (Integra non-VTEC) has long gears for highway cruising. The CR-V transmission is AWD but has very short gears.

partName: Honda S2000 AP1 vs AP2 Retainers
notes: AP1 (F20C) valve retainers are prone to cracking if over-revved. Upgrading to AP2 (F22C) retainers is a standard reliability mod for AP1 owners. They are stronger and a direct fit.
